2Compiling
To compile the example:
Start Visual Studio .NET
Choose Open Project from the File menu.
Navigate to <EiffelEnvision_installation_path>\envision\examples\wel\list_view\ and select listview_demo.eifp
Clicking open loads the selected project
Launch EiffelStudio.
Click Add project
Browse to $ISE_EIFFEL\examples\wel\list_view\.
Choose list_view.ecf
Choose the location where the project will be compiled, by default the same directory containing the configuration file.
Click OK.
2Running After launching the program, a window will be displayed containing a pair of ../../reference/wel_list_view_chart.xmlWEL_LIST_VIEW. Clicking the button marked "style" will modify the style of the lower list view. If you click the mouse within this lower list view, you will see notification of events appearing in the upper list view.
2Under the Hood
LISTVIEW_DEMO redefines init_application in order to load the ../../reference/wel_common_controls_dll_chart.xmlWEL_COMMON_CONTROLS_DLL and the ../../reference/wel_rich_edit_dll_chart.xmlWEL_RICH_EDIT_DLL. LISTVIEW redefines many of the `on_' features inherited from ../../reference/wel_list_view_chart.xmlWEL_LIST_VIEW in order to generate output for the user. The style of the LISTVIEW_DEMO is changed by calling set_style with the required new style. This sample contains the following classes:
LISTVIEW
MAIN_WINDOW
LISTVIEW_DEMO
APPLICATION_IDS
